titleStmt.title: Moravian Lives Personography
titleStmt.principal:
Katherine Mary Faull, Principal Investigator Bucknell University
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
faull@bucknell.edu

Christer Ahlberger, Principal Investigator, 2015-2018 University of Gothenburg
Gothenburg, Sweden
christer.ahlberger@history.gu.se

sourceDesc.p: List of Moravian Lives person entities with reference to persistent identifiers, using ML standard names

revisionDesc.change: Broke personography into files of 50 entries each. This is first file.
Branched to a Bethlehem personography hold file. Kept Fulneck here.
Updated responsibility list, added more names and fields

event.desc: baptized at Dublin by William Horne
ordained as a deacon in Germany
married Anna Elizabeth Watson at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
married to Sarah Rouse at Gracehill by John Hartley
interred at Fulneck by John Beck Holmes

listOffice.office: congregation labourer at Bedford with Culworth
assistant and single brethren’s labourer at Dublin
congregation labourer and director of schools at Fulneck
co-labourer and director of schools at Fulneck

event.desc: baptized at Brethren’s chapel Bristol by Johann Nitschmann
married Anna Rosina Spicer at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
married Eleanor Sutton at St Peter’s Church Birstall
ordained as a presbyter at Ockbrook by Thomas Moore
married Elizabeth Margaret Fraser at Church of St Dunstan in the West, London

listOffice.office: congregation labourer at Woodford Halse and Eydon

event.desc: married Benigna von Zinzendorf at Zeist
ordained as a bishop at Herrnhaag

listOffice.office: member of the Unity Elders' Conference

listOccupation.occupation: tutor in the Orphanage at Herrnhut

listOffice.office: superintendent communities in England and Ireland
superintendent of the settlement at Sarepta

event.desc: baptized in the Church of England
readmitted to congregation with her husband John Walton
interred at Fulneck by C.F. Ramftler
baptized in the Church of England
interred at Fulneck by John Hartley
ordained a deacon at Buckden by the Bishop of Lincoln, George Pretyman
ordained a priest in the Church of England
resigned all offices in the Church of England
received into the Brethren's Church; notified by letter from Brother Wied
consecrated a bishop at Ockbrook by Bishop Charles Augustus Pohlman and Bishop Hans Peter Halbeck

person.education: Sidney College at University of Cambridge

listOccupation.occupation: deacon in the Church of England
priest in the Church of England

listOffice.office: President of the Provincial Helpers Conference

event.desc: admitted to the society of Oxford Methodists by John Wesley
received into Moravian Church at London
consecrated a bishop at Lindsey House by Johannes de Watteville, John Nitschmann, and David Nitschmann
baptized at St Werburgh’s Church Derby
received into Little Boys' Choir at Ockbrook
received into the Great Boys' Choir at Fulneck
received into the congregation at Fulneck
received into the Single Brothers' Choir at Fulneck
married Elizabeth Jackson at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
consecrated as a bishop at Herrnhut by J M Nitschmann, C W Matthiesen, and F J H Nielsen
interred at Ockbrook H E Blandford and J H Baxter

listOffice.office: society labourer and congregation labourer Kimbolton and Stow

event.desc: married Mary Susanna Liley at St Mary’s Church Droylsden
ordained as a presbyter at Fulneck by John Rogers
interred at Chelsea by J A Porter

listOffice.office: deputy at General Synod at Herrnhut
deputy at General Synod at Herrnhut

event.desc: received into the congregation at Devonport
ordained as a deacon at Gracehill Samuel Benade
married Mary Jane Brownlee at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
interred at Fulneck by Joseph Hutton Willey

person.education: apprentice in father’s watchmaker and Jewellery business in Devonport

listOffice.office: single brethren’s labourer and schoolkeeper at Gracehill
single brethren’s labourer and warden at Fulneck
congregation labourer at Woodford and Eydon
congregation labourer and director girls’ boarding school at Fairfield

event.desc: received into the congregation at Niesky
ordained as a deacon at Fulneck by George Traneker
married Mary Radley at St Peter’s Church Birstall
consecrated as a bishop at Herrnhut by C A Baumeister, G M Schneider and F W Foster
married Mary Mortimer at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
interred at Fulneck by John Rogers
baptized at parents' house by John Beck Holmes
interred at Fulneck by J Smith
